statement:
Suppose $f$ is a schlicht function (univalent function on the unit disc
such that $f(0) = 0$ and $f'(0) = 1$) then
$$\frac{1-\lvert z \rvert}{(1+\lvert z \rvert)^3}
\leq
\lvert f'(z) \rvert
\leq
\frac{1+\lvert z \rvert}{(1-\lvert z \rvert)^3},$$ and
$$\frac{\lvert z \rvert}{(1+\lvert z \rvert)^2}
\leq
\lvert f(z) \rvert
\leq
\frac{\lvert z \rvert}{(1-\lvert z \rvert)^2}.$$ Equality holds for one
of the four inequalities at some point $z \not= 0$ if and only if $f$ is
a rotation of the Koebe function.

Following is a generalized distortion theorem.

If $K$ is a compact subset of a region $G \subset {\mathbb{C}}$, then
there is a constant $M$ (depending on $K$) such that for every univalent
function $f$ on $G$ and ever pair of points $z,w \in K$ we have
$$\frac{1}{M}
\leq
\frac{\lvert f'(z) \rvert}{\lvert f'(w) \rvert}
\leq
M .$$

[9]{} John B. Conway. [**]{}. Springer-Verlag, New York, New York, 1995.
